info.title: IBM Business Automation Studio Repository Interface
info.description: THIS CODE IS AUTOMATICALLY GENERATED. See https://github.ibm.com/dba/dbastudio-repo-api. DON'T MODIFY THE CODE. IBM Business Automation Studio REST resources for managing repository artifacts.

get.summary: Retrieve the repository configuration.
get.description: Retrieves the configuration of the repository.

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Business Automation Studio REST APIs.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Indicates the context of the requester.  Can be bastudio, workflowcenter.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of projects in the repository
get.description: Retrieves a list of all projects from repository given the filter and search criteria

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Business Automation Studio REST APIs.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: *For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which support the type will be queried.

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.description:
*For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which support the type will be queried.
 **DEPRECATED:** Underscore in headers can cause problems with nginx. Use repositoryId instead.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type(s) of projects to be returned Valid values are: 'processapp', 'app', 'casesolution', 'general', 'decision', 'agent', 'content', 'digitalworker', 'automation_srvc'.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Lists the values used to filter the results. The default query with no filters specified returns all projects. Valid values are: 'favorite', 'archived', 'not_archived', 'template', 'not_template', 'toolkit', 'not_toolkit', 'regular_app', 'regular_app_orchestration', 'designer_extension', 'target_env_baw', 'target_env_baw_liberty', 'target_env_baw_twas', 'target_env_baw_cp4a'.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Determines how to sort the results. The string is specified as fieldName(asc|desc), where fieldName can be display_name, name, date, recently_opened, or recently_updated.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Searches for a project that has the specified text in the display_name, name or description fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies the position of the first project in a list of entries to return from the query result set.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of projects to return.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of groups that the projects belongs to.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

post.summary: Create a project
post.description: Create a project that is either a processapp, app, casesolution, decision, content, digitalworker, or automation_srvc

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Business Automation Studio REST APIs.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: *For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then a 403 error will be thrown if more than one repository supports the project type.

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.description:
*For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then a 403 error will be thrown if more than one repository supports the project type.
 **DEPRECATED:** Underscore in headers can cause problems with nginx. Use repositoryId instead.

parameters.name: project_details
parameters.description: The body parameters used to create a project.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested operation does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all branches for a project.
get.description: Retrieves a list of all branches of a project from the repository.

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Business Automation Studio REST APIs.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: *For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which will be searched for project_id.

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.description:
*For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which will be searched for project_id.
 **DEPRECATED:** Underscore in headers can cause problems with nginx. Use repositoryId instead.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the project.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Determines how to sort the results. The string is specified as fieldName(asc|desc), where fieldName can be display_name, name, or date.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Lists the values used to filter the results. The default query with no filters specified returns all non-archived branches. Valid values are: 'archived'.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Searches for a branch with the specified text in the display name, description, or name (if acronym is supported) fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies the position of the first branch in a list of entries to return from the query result set.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of branches to return.

parameters.name: optional_parts
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of optional parts to be returned in the response object. Selecting snapshots returns detailed information of associated snapshots. Valid values are: 'snapshots'.
parameters.x-display-name: Optional parts to be returned in the response object.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of snapshots.
get.description: Retrieves a list of snapshots for a specific project and branch.

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Business Automation Studio REST APIs.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: *For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which will be searched for project_id.

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.description:
*For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which will be searched for project_id.
 **DEPRECATED:** Underscore in headers can cause problems with nginx. Use repositoryId instead.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The id of the project.

parameters.name: branch_name
parameters.description: The name of the branch.  If acronyms are supported, then this is the acronym otherwise this is the id.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Lists the values to be used to filter the results. The default query has no filters specified and, therefore, returns all snapshots. Valid values are: 'archived', 'installed'.

parameters.name: optional_parts
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of optional parts to be returned in the response object. The selections where_used and shared_toolkit_usage can be used only when you request toolkit snapshots. Valid values are: 'where_used', 'shared_toolkit_usage', 'possible_actions'.
parameters.x-display-name: Optional parts to be returned in the response object.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Determines how to sort the results. The string is specified as fieldName(asc|desc), where fieldName can be display_name, name, or date.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Searches for a snapshot with the specified text in the display name, description, or name (if acronym is supported) fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: In a list of entries, the offset specifies the position of the first snapshot to return from the query result set.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

get.summary: Export a specified project snapshot.
get.description: Enables the exchange of a project between Workflow Center servers. This API exports the specified project snapshot as a .twx file that you can import onto a Workflow Center server. The suggested file name will be URL-encoded in the Content-Disposition HTTP response header.

parameters.name: BPMCSRFToken
parameters.description: Indicates the cross-site request forgery prevention token for Business Automation Studio REST APIs.

parameters.name: repositoryId
parameters.description: *For Platform Repo Only*. The repository that this request should be directed to.  If not specified then all repositories which will be searched for project_id.

parameters.description: The name of the branch that contains the snapshot. If acronyms are supported, then this is the acronym otherwise this is the id.

parameters.name: snapshot_name
parameters.description: The name of the snapshot. If acronyms are supported, then this is the acronym otherwise this is the id.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the export. If none is specified then it is the default format for the project type.  e.g. for workflow the default format is twx but bpmn is also supported.

parameters.name: use_enhanced_filenames
parameters.description: A value of true will produce more meaningful filenames within the exported file. If the value is false or it is not specified, then it the default internal format will be used.

200.description: The specified snapshot was exported successfully.

post.summary: Activates a specified project snapshot.
post.description:
Activates a snapshot that has been deactivated, stopped, or undeployed. Activated snapshots can receive and process requests.

Only the process is activated when you activate a workflow project snapshot. If the workflow project uses BPEL processes and the templates were stopped, follow the instructions in "Administering BPEL process and task templates" in the product's IBM Knowledge Center start the templates.

parameters.description: The name of the snapshot. If acronyms are supported, then this is the acronym otherwise this is the id.

200.description: The common-assets were successfully retrieved. The operations should only contain the names of the operation used with no parameter information.  The interface should not be returned.

400.description: The request contains invalid or missing parameters.

403.description: The caller is not authorized to perform the request.

404.description: The requested resource does not exist.

display_name.description: The display name of the repository.

type.description: The type of the repository: workflow, decision, digitalworker, or platform.

administration.description: Adminstration user access rights to the repository.

contributors.description: Resource Registry entries registered by Contributors.

servers.description: Display of deployment targets for the repository projects.

project_config.description: The configuration for a project type

display_name.description: The display name for the project type.

solution.description: Indicates whether the definition is for solutions or not.

acronym.description: Whether the project supports the concept of an acronym.  If not, the id will be used when needed instead of the name.

platform_properties.description: Additional project config properties.  Used by the platform to specify project config origin when multiple repos are being shown.

supports.description: What the project in this repository supports

project_supports.description: What the project in this repository supports

common_asset_provider.description: Whether the project can provide common assets.

common_asset_consumer.description: Whether the project can consume common assets. For auotmation_services, the interaction patterns and protocols supported are request_response_sync and https if not specified. Otherwise they are what is specified in the consumer_interaction_patterns and consumer_interaction_protocols and and MUST include ALL supported interaction patterns and protocols.

consumer_interaction_patterns.description: The interaction patterns supported by automation services of this project type.  If not specified the default is [request_response_sync]

consumer_protocols.description: The protocols supported by automation services of this project type.  If not specified the default is [https]

pagination_and_search.description: Indicator whether this project type supports pagination and search.

principals_type_individual.description: The project principal support individual user.

target_environment.description: Supports the specification of a target environment.

toolkit_only.description: Indicator whether this project type is a toolkit only or not.

supported_toolkit_types.description: Supported project type for the toolkit of this project type. Valid values are: 'processapp', 'app', 'general'.

branches.description: This project under this type suppports branches or not.

grouping.description: Indicator whether this project type supports grouping.

branch_supports.description: The configuration for a project branches

target_environment.description: Supports the specification of a target environment.

snapshot_supports.description: The configuration for a project snapshots

target_environment.description: Supports the specification of a target environment.

project_type_groupings.description: The groupings for a project type

display_name.description: The display name for the grouping.

groups.description: The groups belonging to this grouping.

grouping_groups.description: The group belonging to the grouping

display_name.description: The display name for the group.

artifact_names.description: The result of a query for project, branch, or snapshot names.

items.description: The name of the project, branch, or snapshot.  If acronyms are not supported this should be the same as id.

projects.description: The result of a query for projects.

display_name.description: The display name of the project.

name.description: The name of the project.  If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

subtype.description: The subtype of the project. For projects that support subtypes

default_branch_id.description: The id of the default branch of the project.

default_branch_name.description: The name of the default branch of the project.

creation_date.description: The date when the project was created.

creator_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the project.

creator_user_name.description: The user name of the user who created the project.

creator_full_user_name.description: The full name of the user who created the project.

last_modified_date.description: The date when the project was last modified.

last_modified_user_id.description: The ID of the user who last modified the project.

last_modified_user_name.description: The user name of the user who last modified the project.

last_modified_full_user_name.description: The full user name of the user who last modified the project.

toolkit.description: Indicates whether the project is a toolkit.

template.description: Indicates whether the project is a template.

immutable.description: Indicates whether the project can be changed.

archived.description: Indicates whether the project is archived.

favorite.description: Indicates whether the project is a favorite for the current user.

can_delete.description: Indicates whether the project can be deleted.

icon_set.description: Indicates whether the project has an icon set.

designer_url.description: The url to open the project in its designer.

permissions.description: The permissions that the current user has to access and work with the project. Valid values are: 'list', 'create', 'read', 'update', 'delete', 'write', 'administration'.

repo_id.description: Repository id that originates this project.

groups.description: The groups that this project belongs to.

case_display_name.description: The display name of the case solutions.

new_project.description: The body parameters for creating a project.

name.description: The name of the new project. Note that for workflow projects the name can't start with a number or include special characters, spaces, or JavaScript-reserved words; the name must be less than or equal to seven characters; the name must be unique. For case solution projects, the name must be between two and five English alphanumeric characters and must start with an English alphabetic character; the name for a case solution doesn't need to be unique.

display_name.description: The display name of the new project.  For case solution projects, the name must be unique, must start with an alphabetic character, and must not contain special characters.

description.description: The description of the new project.

toolkit.description: Indicates whether the project being created is a toolkit. By default, the project being created is not a toolkit.

template.description: Indicates whether the project being created is a template. By default, the project being created is not a template.

type.description: Indicates whether the project is a processapp, casesolution, app, general, digitalworker, content, decision, or automation_srvc. By default, the project being created is a processapp.

subtype.description: Indicates whether the project has a subtype. Required for business applications: app_App, app_BizO, null implies app_App. By default, the project being created doesn't have a subtype.

base_project_name.description: For case solution and app projects, the name of the original template or project that this new project or template is based on.  If acronyms are supported, then this is the acronym otherwise this is the id.

base_snapshot_name.description: For case solution and app projects, the name of the snapshot of the original template or project.  If acronyms are supported, then this is the acronym otherwise this is the id.

groups.description: A list of the groups that this project can be a member of.

action.description: An action that can be performed on an artifact.

display_name.description: The display name of the action. This will appear in the UI.

description.description: The description of the action. This will appear in the UI.

is_link_action.description: Indicates if action should open a link.

href.description: The full destination url if the action is of type link.

update_project.description: Use these parameters to update the project details.

name.description: The new name of the project. Note that in most cases names cannot be changed.

display_name.description: The display name of the project.

description.description: The new description of the project.

base_project_name.description: Indicates the name of the base template or project that this project or template is based on. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

base_snapshot_name.description: Indicates the name of the snapshot of the base template or project. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

case_display_name.description: The new display name of case solution projects. Only applies to case solutions

update_base_template_snapshot.description: Indicates whether the app project must use its base template's newest snapshot. This parameter is valid only when base_project_name and base_snapshot_name are empty. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

immutable.description: Indicates whether the project can be changed.

favorite.description: Indicates if this project is a favorite for the user.

offset.description: The offset into the total list of artifacts.

total_size.description: The total number of artifacts in the list.

property.description: A generic property that contains a name value pair

boolean_property.description: A generic property that contains a name and boolean value pair

exception.description: An exception object that describes the details of the REST API error.

error_number.description: The message ID of the exception.

error_message.description: The message text of the exception.

items.description: An array of parameter strings inserted into the error message.

error_message_parameters.description: Message text parameters for the exception.

principal.description: Details of a user or group in a container.

type.description: The type of the principal can be either user or group.

full_name.description: The full name of the principal.

readOnly.description: Indicates if principal is read only.

in_project_area.description: Indicates if principal is in project area.

principals.description: The result of a query for principals.

new_principal.description: The parameters for adding a user or group to a repository or project.

type.description: The type of the principal can be either user or group.

new_principals.description: A list of users and groups to be associated with a repository or project.

permissions.description: Permission details for the specified principal

permission_level.description: Indicates whether permissions are for repository or project

branch.description: A branch represents a branch in a repository.

name.description: The name of the branch. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

display_name.description: The display name of the branch.

creation_date.description: The date when the branch was created.

creator_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the branch.

creator_user_name.description: The user name of the user who created the branch.

creator_full_user_name.description: The full name of the user who created the branch.

last_modified_date.description: The date when the branch was last modified.

last_modified_user_id.description: The ID of the user who last modified the branch.

last_modified_user_name.description: The user name of the user who last modified the branch.

last_modified_full_user_name.description: The full name of the user who last modified the branch.

designer_url.description: The url to open the branch in its designer.

properties.description: Additional branch properties. e.g. archived_on, original_last_modified_date, original_last_modified_user_name

boolean_properties.description: Additional branch properties. e.g. is_default, can_archive, archived, can_delete

repo_id.description: Theid of the repo that contains the branch.

project_id.description: The id of the project that contains the branch.

snapshots.description: Snapshots that belong to the specific branch.

base_branch.description: If acronyms are supported, the name the branch or if not supported the id of the branch that will be used as the base of the new branch. Only one of base_snapshot or base_branch need be specified.

base_snapshot.description: If acronyms are supported, the name the snapshot or if not supported the id of the snapshot that will be used as the base of the new branch. Only one of base_snapshot or base_branch need be specified.

new_branch.description: The body parameters for creating a branch.

display_name.description: The display name of the new branch.

name.description: The name of the new branch. (If acronyms are supported)

description.description: The description of the new branch.

base_branch.description: If acronyms are supported, the name the branch or if not supported the id of the branch that will be used as the base of the new branch. Only one of base_snapshot or base_branch need be specified.

base_snapshot.description: If acronyms are supported, the name the snapshot or if not supported the id of the snapshot that will be used as the base of the new branch. Only one of base_snapshot or base_branch need be specified.

update_branch.description: The body parameters for updating a branch.

display_name.description: The display name of the new branch.

name.description: The name of the branch. (If acronyms are not supported this field will not be passed)

display_name.description: The display name of the snapshot.

name.description: The name of the snapshot. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

creation_date.description: The date when the snapshot was created.

creator_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the snapshot.

creator_user_name.description: The user name of the user who created the snapshot.

creator_full_user_name.description: The full name of the user who created the snapshot.

last_modified_date.description: The date when the snapshot was last modified.

last_modified_user_id.description: The ID of the user who modified last.

last_modified_user_name.description: The user name of the user who modified last.

last_modified_full_user_name.description: The full user name of the user who modified last.

branch_name.description: The name of the branch the snapshot belongs to.

designer_url.description: The url to open the snapshot in its designer.

boolean_properties.description: Boolean properties containing state. e.g. releasable, archived, active, installable, installed, advanced, started, default, tip

properties.description: Boolean properties containing state. e.g. error_counter, state, status

possible_actions.description: A list of the possible actions for an application.

project_id.description: The name of the project the snapshot belongs to.

repo_id.description: Theid of the repo that contains the branch.

base_project_name.description: Indicates the name of the base template or project that this project or template is based on. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

base_snapshot_name.description: Indicates the name of the snapshot of the base template or project. If acronyms are not suppoted this should be the same as id.

deployments.description: A list of all the deployments the snapshot has.

where_used.description: A list of project summaries that depend on this snapshot.

publish_status.description: The published state of the snapshot.  This is set by the aggregator by cross referencing with the common asset catalog.

new_snapshot.description: The body parameters for creating a snapshot.

display_name.description: The display name of the new snapshot. The maximum length is 64 characters. You can include any of the following characters in the name: A-Z 0-9 _

name.description: The name of the new snapshot.

description.description: The description of the new snapshot.

display_name.description: The display name of the snapshot.

name.description: The name of the snapshot. (only if acronyms are supported)

boolean_properties.description: Boolean properties containing state. e.g. releasable, archived, active, installed, advanced, started, default, tip

properties.description: Boolean properties containing state. e.g. error_counter, state, status

comments.description: The results of the retrieved comments.

creator_user_name.description: The name of the user who added the comment.

new_comment.title: Comment Post Parameters
new_comment.description: The body parameters for creating a comment

target_environment.description: The environment that the project/branch/snapshot is meant to be run on.  If not specified it will be the default environment for the project type.

project_type.description: The type of the project: processapp, casesolution, app, general, decision, content, digitalworker, or automation_srvc.

project_subtype.description: The subtype of the project: app[App, BizO, null==App]. By default, the project being created doesn't have a subtype.

deployment.description: Deployment information about a snapshot of a project.

id.description: The ID of the project deployed.

creation_date.description: The date when the deployed project was created.

creator_user_id.description: The ID of the user who created the project that is deployed.

creator_user_name.description: The user name of the user who created the project that is deployed.

snapshot_id.description: The snapshot ID of the project that is deployed.

snapshot_name.description: The name of the deployed snapshot.

server_id.description: The server ID of where the snapshot is deployed.

deploy_status.description: The status of the project that is deployed.

deploy_description.description: The description of the deployed project.

state.description: The state of the deployed project.

boolean_properties.description: Boolean properties containing state of a deployment. e.g. is_archived, deleteable, deployment_package_exists

properties.description: Properties containing state of a deployment. e.g. instances

name.description: The name of the project. If acronyms are not supported this should be the same as id.

display_name.description: The display name of the project.

common_assets.description: A list of platform common asset descriptors.

id.description: The UUID of the common asset.

name.description: The name of the comon asset.

description.description: The description of the common asset.

type.description: The type of the common asset.  Can be automation_service or common_data.

sub_type.description: The sub-type of the common asset.

version.description: The version of the common asset.  Id+version makes the common_asset unique.

is_default.description: Whether the specified version of the Common Asset is the default version.

can_support_default_at_runtime.description: Whether this common asset can support a default value at runtime.

protocol.description: The interaction protocol for this common asset if it is an automation service.  If not specifed, the default is https.

operations.description: The name and description of the parameters provided by the automation service.

interface.description: Base64 encoded interface of the common asset. This interface can be used by a consumer to consume the common asset.

op_parms.description: The name and description of the parameters provided by the automation service.

op_interaction_pattern.description: The interaction pattern for this operation.  If not specifed, the default is request_response_sync.

parm_is_output.description: True if an output parm, false or undefined otherwise.

origin.description: The origin of a common asset

snapshot_info.description: The snapshot origin of a common asset

repo_id.description: The id of the repository that contains the project.

project_id.description: The uuid of the project of the project.

project_name.description: The short name of the project. If acronyms are not supported then should be the id, or can be omitted.

project_display_name.description: The display name of the project. Shown in the UI.

branch_name.description: The short name of the branch. If acronyms are not supported then should be the id.

branch_display_name.description: The display name of the branch. Shown in the ui.

snapshot_name.description: The short name of the snapshot. If acronyms are not supported then should be the id.

snapshot_display_name.description: The display name of the snapshot. Shown  in the ui.

interaction_pattern.description: The possible interaction patterns for automation services.

protocol.description: The possible protocols for automation services.

connection_info.description: The connection information for an external common asset

id.description: The id of the asynch Task.  Use the Platform /task API to get the asynch details.
